Description: Textile fragment; torn strip of undyed, medium to coarse quality linen cloth - mummy-wrapping(?). The weave is loose and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm and weft c.6 picks per 10mm. Edges are torn.
Curator's comments: Uncertain use; torn stip suggests a mummy with torn strips, which would suggest, in turn, a post Old Kingdom or Middle Kingdom date, but it was possibly torn in modern times. Possibly the same cloth as BM 6558. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
